title: AI Is Giving English Majors Some Unexpected Leverage in the Job Market
summary:
Pre-pandemic, the number of English majors at the university was shrinking, part of a broader decline in English across the country, he said.
But there's been a rebound, with the number of English majors rising 9% since 2021.
Courtesy of CU BoulderDerided by some as useless, the utility of the English major has long been questioned.
That means that, after years of mocking, English majors are finally getting recognized for their usefulness.
Still, it's a dreary labor market for everyone — English majors includedThere are signs of employment hope for the English majors.

title: What Happened to Software is Happening to Finance and Accounting
summary:
What happened to software is now happening to finance.
What happened to software is now happening to finance.
So I became a finance person who codes — a weird niche that turned out to be excellent preparation for what's happening right now.
If you're already deep in this: I'd love to see what you're building.
I'm thinking of putting together a mini hackathon for people building at this intersection — finance, AI, automation.

title: Uber launches robotaxi support project to aid AV partners
summary:
Now, the ridehail giant is launching a new initiative to support its third-party robotaxi partners called Uber Autonomous Solutions.
It’s an acknowledgement that many AV developers aren’t as cash rich as Waymo, Tesla, and other leading AV developers.
Uber says this data can help its partners improve their own autonomous vehicles as they seek to scale their robotaxi business more quickly.
Essentially, Uber is telling its AV partners to stick to the important stuff — developing software to power autonomous driving — and it will take care of the rest.
The company has said it wants to use its reach and scale to help autonomous vehicles proliferate across the globe.

Artur Widak/NurPhoto via Getty ImagesPwC, like many consulting firms, is investing heavily in engineering talent.
These files often underpin business-critical decisions, yet PwC "found that even today's modern AI was very poorly suited to managing these big enterprise spreadsheets," Wood said.
In January, PwC launched a dedicated tech engineering career track to attract more technical talent, saying it wants to become "a destination for top engineering talent."
The second reimagines professional services from scratch: "If you were to start from a blank piece of paper, what would professional services look like in an AI agent world?"

title: How to Hide Google’s AI Overviews From Your Search Results
summary:
While there’s no off switch to avoid this smorgasbord of AI tools entirely, there is one keyboard trick you can use to dodge Google’s AI Overviews for a brief respite.
It’s an option WIRED readers highlighted under a recent article about scams found in Google’s AI Overviews.
“People find Search more helpful with AI Overviews, and they're coming back to search more as a result,” a Google spokesperson tells WIRED.
The exception seems to be on Android—at least on a Google Pixel phone we tested with, using “–ai” removed AI Overviews.
When Google launched AI Overviews in 2024, it was a major turning point for the search engine.

title: Making frontier cybersecurity capabilities available to defenders
summary:
Claude Code Security, a new capability built into Claude Code on the web, is now available in a limited research preview.
Claude Code Security is intended to put this power squarely in the hands of defenders and protect code against this new category of AI-enabled attack.
How Claude Code Security worksStatic analysis—a widely deployed form of automated security testing—is typically rule-based, meaning it matches code against known vulnerability patterns.
Nothing is applied without human approval: Claude Code Security identifies problems and suggests solutions, but developers always make the call.
Claude Code Security is one step towards our goal of more secure codebases and a higher security baseline across the industry.

title: Mark Cuban on 2 Types of AI Users: Learners and Non-Learners
summary:
Mark Cuban said people who use AI either use it to learn everything or to avoid learning.
Mark Cuban said people who use AI either use it to learn everything or to avoid learning.
Tom Williams/CQ-Roll Call, Inc via Getty ImagesMark Cuban said people who use AI either use it to learn everything or to avoid learning.
lighning bolt icon An icon in the shape of a lightning bolt.
Bill Gurley, a partner at the Silicon Valley venture capitalist firm Benchmark, agrees "100%" with Cuban that there are two types of AI users.

title: DeepMind's CEO says using AI can make you a genius — or hurt your critical thinking skills
summary:
The Google DeepMind CEO said that AI is just like the internet when it comes to learning.
In a Thursday interview with entrepreneur Varun Mayya on the sidelines of the India AI Impact Summit, the Google DeepMind CEO said that AI is just like the internet.
"With AI, if you use it in a lazy way, it will make you worse at critical thinking and so on," he said.
It merged with Google Brain in 2023 to form Google DeepMind, the lab behind tools such as Gemini and Nano Banana.
At a June conference, the CEO of French AI lab Mistral said that a risk of using AI for everything is that humans will stop trying.

title: Scott Adams' AI Resurrection Sparks Backlash and an Ethics Debate
summary:
"The real Scott Adams gave explicit permission on the record multiple times for people to create and operate an AI version of him," the AI Adams said in a post on February 5.
The Adams estate did not respond to requests for comment from Business Insider.
"It's my belief this is something that he wanted," John Arrow, an AI venture capitalist who created the digital Adams, said.
The AI Adams identifies itself as artificial intelligence at the start of its clips and does not appear to solicit money.
For now, the AI "Scott Adams" fight is one family's public line-drawing exercise.

title: The path to ubiquitous AI
summary:
The path to ubiquitous AIBy Ljubisa BajicMany believe AI is the real deal.
About TaalasFounded 2.5 years ago, Taalas developed a platform for transforming any AI model into custom silicon.
AI inference is the most critical computational workload that humanity has ever faced, and the one that stands to gain the most from specialization.
The Silicon Llama is aggressively quantized, combining 3-bit and 6-bit parameters, which introduces some quality degradations relative to GPU benchmarks.
Our first products, beginning with our hard-wired Llama and rapidly expanding to more capable models, eliminate high latency and cost, the core barriers to ubiquitous AI.

title: Why fake AI videos of UK urban decline are taking over social media
summary:
"If people saw it and they immediately knew it was fake, then they would just scroll.
The selling point of generative AI models is that they look real," RadialB tells me over the phone.
He refuses to share his real name but reveals he is in his 20s and from the north-west of England.
He has never been to Croydon.

title: Sony’s WH-CH720N headphones offer excellent value at full price, but right now they're a steal.
summary:
We've tested oodles of noise-canceling headphones and the Sony WH-CH720N might have an unfortunate name, but they're the best budget-friendly pair we've tried.
They usually offer good value when selling for the full $178 MSRP, but right now they've fallen to $95 shipped on Amazon and $100 on Best Buy.
These headphones are well-built and well-designed, with great active noise cancellation and robust sound.
Moreover, if you want a pair of over-hear wireless headphones with active noise cancellation, it's very difficult to get that in a package this affordable.
Check those stories out if you're on the hunt for wireless gaming earbuds or open earbuds.

title: Sam Altman says Elon Musk's idea of putting data centers in space is 'ridiculous'
summary:
Lighning bolt icon An icon in the shape of a lightning bolt.
Orbital data centers are not something that's going to matter at scale this decade."
In February, SpaceX said its goal is to launch a "constellation of a million satellites that operate as orbital data centers."
Tech and AI companies rely on data centers to power their products, like large language models and chatbots.
Those data centers, however, can deplete water resources, strain power grids, increase pollution, and decrease the overall quality of life.

title: Politicians can't ignore data centers anymore
summary:
National and local politicians are calling for data centers to pay their fare share of rising utility costs.
Until recently, most states have courted data centers, enticed by promises that they will create jobs and sprout long-term revenue from vacant land.
There's still about a fifth of people in the middle who don't have feelings on data centers yet, but their numbers are shrinking.
If data centers don't start footing the bill for higher energy use, voters are likely to keep turning on them.
In Virginia, home to the world's largest concentration of data centers, aka Data Center Alley, backlash has been mounting for several years.
